SEARCH
Module com.example.platformerplain
Package com.example.platformerplain.move.state

Class MoveData

java.lang.Object
com.example.platformerplain.move.state.MoveData
public class MoveData extends Object
Represents the movement state for a player character. This class maintains the current movement state and handles the logic for different movement states.
Author:
Changyu Li

  • Constructor Details

    • MoveData

      public MoveData(MoveState moveState, boolean isFacingLeft, boolean isTouchingGround, boolean isTouchingWall, Coord2D velocity)
      Parameters:
      moveState - the initial movement state of the player
      isFacingLeft - indicates if the player is facing left
      isTouchingGround - indicates if the player is on the ground
      isTouchingWall - indicates if the player is touching a wall
      velocity - the current velocity of the player

  • Method Details

    • setState

      public void setState(MoveState state)
      Sets the current movement state and initializes the corresponding state handler.
      Parameters:
      state - the new movement state

    • getState

      public MoveState getState()
      Retrieves the current movement state.
      Returns:
      the current movement state

    • analyzeState

      public void analyzeState(MoveData moveData)
      Analyzes the current state of the movement state using the active state handler.
      Parameters:
      moveData - the MoveData instance to analyze

    • drawPlayer

      public void drawPlayer(Player player, MoveState lastState, Animation animation)
      Updates the player appearance based on the current state and animation.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to update
      lastState - the last movement state of the player
      animation - the animation to be applied

    • stateIs

      public boolean stateIs(MoveState state)
      Checks if the current movement state matches the specified state.
      Parameters:
      state - the state to check against
      Returns:
      true if the current state matches, false otherwise
